Events.OnCreate:
(switch ; No mission if we've already meet Antarctica (rpgCharacterGetQuickRel &unidCaptainHelios;) (msnDestroy gSource)
; Or if the Antarctica is destroyed (rpgCharacterGetStatus &unidCaptainHelios;) (msnDestroy gSource)
; Set up the mission (block ( (targetObj (sysFindObject Nil "sN +cscAntarctica;")) ) (if targetObj (block Nil (msnSetData gSource 'targetID (objGetID targetObj)) (msnRegisterForEvents gSource targetObj) ) ) ) )
Events.OnObjDestroyed:
(switch ; Antarctica destroyed
(= (objGetID aObjDestroyed) (msnGetData gSource 'targetID)) (switch ; If the Antarctica entered a stargate, then this mission ; failed.
(= aDestroyReason 'enteredStargate) (msnFailure gSource)
; If the Antarctica ascended, then it just means the player ; left the system. We figure out whether or not it was ; able to escape.
(= aDestroyReason 'ascended) (block ( (missionObj (@ (msnFind "ao +unid:&msEscapeFromDantalion;;") 0)) ) (switch
; If the mission is not accepted, then we skip. If the ; player goes back, they can continue the mission.
(not missionObj) Nil
; If the mission was declined, and the Antarctica ; ascended, then it means that she escaped.
(msnGetProperty missionObj 'isDeclined) (msnFailure gSource)
; If there are cruisers left, then we assume that the ; Antarctica was destroyed.
(gr (msnGetData missionObj 'cruisersLeft) 0) (msnSuccess gSource)
; Otherwise, we assume the Antarctica survived.
(msnFailure gSource) ) )
; Otherwise, the Antarctica was destroyed.
(msnSuccess gSource) ) )
Events.OnDebriefed:
(block ( (status (rpgCharacterGetStatus &unidCaptainHelios;)) (stationObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetProperty gSource 'ownerID))) missionObj ) (switch (msnGetProperty gSource 'isFailure) (block Nil (objSetData gPlayerShip 'fleetXP 600) (objSetData gPlayerShip 'fleetLevel 3) (typSetData &msCSCLamplighterTesting; 'status 'notPlayer) ) (= status 'betrayed) (typSetData &msCSCLamplighterTesting; 'status 'notPlayer)
(= status 'destroyedByPlayer) (block Nil (typSetData &msCSCLamplighterTesting; 'status 'player)
; Create the mission now so player can go straight to dockmaster (if (setq missionObj (msnCreate &msCSCLamplighterTesting; stationObj)) (msnAccept missionObj) ) )
(= status 'destroyed) (typSetData &msCSCLamplighterTesting; 'status 'fleetCaptain) ) )

Language.Text: Hunt for the CSC Antarctica
The CSC Antarctica has gone rogue. Admiral Decker has ordered you to locate and destroy the carrier.

As you enter the bridge, you see Admiral Conrad Decker talking with his XO. A guard approaches you and says,
"The admiral would like you to wait for him at his quarters."

Waiting in the admiral's quarters you see the artifacts of his life scattered around the room—charts, papers, and empty glasses are randomly distributed. Pictures of the men and women that he's lost judge from the walls.
Fifteen minutes later, the admiral walks in.

"%shipName% armed like a battleship out here at the edge. What are you looking for?"
"I'll make a deal with you. Help me with my problem and I'll give you something that will help you."

"%shipName% armed like a battleship and a lonely pilot heading for the Core. Another plaything for the Gods. What a waste.
"I'll make a deal with you. Help me with my problem and I'll give you something you're going to need out there."

"My problem is Captain Helios and the CSC Antarctica. Two months ago we were on joint operations against an Ares stronghold. Four carriers; hundreds of Centurions; one of the most complicated operations of the war."
"A light-minute out, she breaks formation and recalls her wing. She left us out there at the most critical point!"

"She's gone rogue. Or worse. And with a carrier. And with the secrets she knows... I really don't have a choice."
The admiral looks away, out the porthole. He looks tired. And old.

When the admiral turns back to you there is a new intensity in his eyes and as he stands up his fists are clenched.
"Your mission is to hunt down the Antarctica. And to destroy her, if you can."

Admiral Decker talks with his XO at his center console. They see you enter, and the admiral comes up to you quietly:
"We've had a sighting of the Antarctica somewhere in this system! You know what to do. Return here when you've accomplished your mission."

The bridge of the CSC Terra is chaotic, but efficient. Various officers discuss issues at their panels, raising their voice above the chatter of comm traffic. The admiral is not on the bridge, but the XO approaches you:
"I don't envy your mission. We don't have fresh intel on the Antarctica; you'll have to search system by system, I'm afraid."
Admiral Decker talks with his XO at the center of a chaotic, but efficient bridge. The Admiral sees you come in, but he seems too busy to be able to talk to you.

Admiral Decker talks with his XO at his center console. They see you enter, and the XO comes up to you quietly:
"Still no sign of the Antarctica. We've had reports that it might be in the Dantalion system."
The bridge grows quiet as you enter. All the officers stare at you, some with disgust, others with pity. The XO walks up to you: "The admiral is waiting for you in his quarters."

The admiral broods in his chambers. He stares at you coldly:
"What happened out there? How did the Antarctica escape? If I ever find out that you helped them, I will make sure that you hang as a traitor! Until then, you are demoted to Master Sergeant. Now get the hell out of here."

As you enter the bridge all the officers rise and applaud. Admiral Decker stands next to you and says,
"The Fleet owes you a great debt. The valor and heroism that you showed in defeating the Antarctica will stand as a beacon of hope in this bloody war!"
After much cheering and congratulations, the Admiral leads you to his quarters for a private conversation.

"You've done your part of the bargain, now let me help you with your journey. For the last few years we've been working on a new weapon—something that can hurt the Ares and win this war. I want you to test this new weapon. The dockmaster will install it. Good luck!"

As you enter the bridge all the officers cheer. Admiral Decker stands next to you and announces,
"I can now confirm that the rogue ship Antarctica has been destroyed!"
After much cheering, the Admiral leads you to his quarters for a private conversation.

"Thanks for tracking down the Antarctica—we couldn't have done it without you. Now it's my turn to help you."
"For the last few years we've been working on a new weapon—something that will win this war. I want you to test it. Report to the dockmaster and he will explain. Good luck!"

"Thanks for tracking down the Antarctica—we couldn't have done it without you. I know you're on your way to the Core, but if you stay with the Fleet and make captain, I guarantee that I'll remember your service. Good luck, and remember what I said."
The bridge grows quiet as you enter. All the officers stare at you, some with disgust, others with pity. The XO walks up to you: "The admiral is waiting for you in his quarters."

The admiral sits at his desk quietly studying you. He says,
"You're a cold-blooded killer, do you know that? I heard how you betrayed Captain Helios. I know she deserved it, but I'm glad that you're leaving Human Space. I'll see you in hell."
